intro: Galium galeottianum, commonly known as the scarlet bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its slender stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pink, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are simple, ovate, and often covered with fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
